00027 ## @package pyp_nrm
00028 # pyp_nrm contains several procedures for computing numerator relationship matrices and for
00029 # performing operations on those matrices.  It also contains routines for computing CoI on
00030 # large pedigrees using the recursive method of VanRaden (1992).
00031 ##

00048 ##
00049 # a_matrix() is used to form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  DEPRECATED.
00050 # use fast_a_matrix() instead.
00051 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00052 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00053 # @retval The NRM as a NumPy matrix.
00054 def a_matrix(pedobj, save=0):
00055     """
00056     Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  DEPRECATED.
00057     """
00058     try: logging.info('Entered a_matrix()')
00059     except: pass
00060     l = pedobj.medata.num_records
00061     # Grab some array tools
00062     try:
00063         a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate dimension
00064         for row in xrange(l):
00065             for col in xrange(row,l):
00066                 # cast these b/c items are read from the pedigree file as characters, not integers
00067                 pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID)
00068                 pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID)
00069                 pedobj.pedigree[col].damID = int(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID)
00070                 #if pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID == 0 and pedobj.pedigree[col].damID == 0:
00071                 if str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']) and str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00072                     if row == col:
00073                         # both parents unknown and assumed unrelated
00074                         a[row,col] = 1.
00075                     else:
00076                         a[row,col] = 0.
00077                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00078                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00079                     # sire unknown, dam known
00080                     if row == col:
00081                         a[row,col] = 1.
00082                     else:
00083                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1]
00084                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00085                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00086                     # sire known, dam unknown
00087                     if row == col:
00088                         a[row,col] = 1.
00089                     else:
00090                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1]
00091                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00092                 elif str(pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']) and str(pedobj.pedigree[col].damID) != str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
00093                     # both parents known
00094                     if row == col:
00095                         a[row,col] = 1. + ( 0.5 * a[pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1] )
00096                     else:
00097                         intermediate = a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID-1] + a[row,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID-1]
00098                         finprod = 0.5 * intermediate
00099                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * intermediate
00100                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00101                 else:
00102                     print '[ERROR]: There is a problem with the sire (ID %s) and/or dam (ID %s) of animal %s' % (pedobj.pedigree[col].sireID,pedobj.pedigree[col].damID,pedobj.pedigree[col].animalID)
00103                     break
00104     except:
00105         a = numpy.zeros([1,1],'d')
00106 
00107     if save:
00108         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_a_matrix_','.dat')
00109         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00110         for row in xrange(l):
00111             line = ''
00112             for col in xrange(l):
00113                 if col == 0:
00114                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00115                 else:
00116                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00117             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00118             aout.write(line)
00119         aout.close()
00120 
00121     try: logging.info('Exited a_matrix()')
00122     except: pass
00123     return a

00125 ##
00126 # Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix() is a hacked version of a_matrix()
00127 # modified to try and improve performance.  Lists of animal, sire, and dam IDs are formed and accessed rather
00128 # than myped as it is much faster to access a member of a simple list rather than an attribute of an object in a
00129 # list.  Further note that only the diagonal and upper off-diagonal of A are populated.  This is done to save
00130 # n(n+1) / 2 matrix writes.  For a 1000-element array, this saves 500,500 writes.
00131 # @param pedigree A PyPedal pedigree.
00132 # @param pedopts PyPedal options.
00133 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00134 # @param method Use dense or sparse matrix storage.
00135 # @param debug Print NRM for debugging
00136 # @param fill Fill both the upper and lower off-diagonals when 1, only the upper otherwise.
00137 # @retval The NRM as Numarray matrix.
00138 def fast_a_matrix(pedigree, pedopts, save=0, method='dense', debug=0, fill=1):
00139     """
00140     Form a numerator relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix() is a hacked
00141     version of a_matrix() modified to try and improve performance.  Lists of animal,
00142     sire, and dam IDs are formed and accessed rather than myped as it is much faster to
00143     access a member of a simple list rather than an attribute of an object in a
00144     list.  Further note that only the diagonal and upper off-diagonal of A are
00145     populated.  This is done to save n(n+1) / 2 matrix writes.  For a 1000-element
00146     array, this saves 500,500 writes.
00147     """
00148 #     try: logging.info('Entered fast_a_matrix()')
00149 #     except: pass
00150 #     print '\t\t\tEntered pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00151 #    print 'Entered pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00152 #    print pedopts
00153 #    print '[DEBUG]: method = ', method
00154 
00155     # Check the foundercoi flag and do what it says.
00156     foundercoi = int(pedopts['foundercoi'])
00157     # Check to make sure that foundercoi is either 0 or 1.
00158     if foundercoi not in [0, 1]: foundercoi = 0
00159 
00160     _animals = {}
00161     _sires = {}
00162     _dams = {}
00163     l = len(pedigree)
00164     #method = 'dense'
00165     if method not in ['dense','sparse']:
00166         method = 'dense'
00167     #try:
00168     # Use PySparse to provide sparse matrix storage for large
00169     # relationship matrices.
00170     if method == 'sparse':
00171         try:
00172 #            from pysparse import spmatrix
00173             a = spmatrix.ll_mat_sym(l*l)
00174             for i in xrange(l):
00175                 a[i,i] = 1.
00176         except:
00177 #            logging.error('Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse! Using NumPY dense matrices instead.')
00178 #            print '[ERROR]: Could not import the spmatrix module from PySparse! Using NumPY dense matrices instead.'
00179             a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00180     # Otherwise, use Numpy and its dense matrices
00181     else:
00182         a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate
00183         # print a
00184     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00185         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Started forming animal, sire, and dam lists at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00186     #print '\tIdx\tID\tName'
00187     for i in xrange(l):
00188     a[i,i] = 1.0
00189     if foundercoi == 1:
00190             if str(pedigree[i].sireID) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(pedigree[i].damID) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00191                 a[i,i] = 1.0 + pedigree[i].fa
00192         try:
00193             _a = _animals[i]
00194         except KeyError:
00195             _animals[i] = int(pedigree[i].animalID)
00196             #print 'A:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].animalID, '\t', pedigree[i].name
00197         try:
00198             _s = _sires[i]
00199         except KeyError:
00200             _sires[i] = int(pedigree[i].sireID)
00201             #print 'S:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].sireID, '\t', pedigree[i].sireName
00202         try:
00203             _d = _dams[i]
00204         except KeyError:
00205             _dams[i] = int(pedigree[i].damID)
00206             #print 'D:\t', i, '\t', pedigree[i].damID, '\t', pedigree[i].damName
00207     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00208         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Finished forming animal, sire, and dam lists at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00209         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Started computing A at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00210     #print '_animals: ', _animals
00211     #print '_sires: ', _sires
00212     #print '_dams: ', _dams
00213     #print 'missing_parent: ', pedopts['missing_parent']
00214     #print l
00215     for row in xrange(l):
00216         #print 'row: ', row
00217         for col in xrange(row,l):
00218             #print 'col: ',
00219             #print ' ', col,
00220             if str(_sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(_dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00221                 # sire and dam unknown
00222                 pass
00223             elif str(_sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00224                 # sire unknown, dam known
00225                 if row == col:
00226                     pass
00227                 else:
00228                     a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,_dams[col]-1]
00229                     if fill == 1:
00230             a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00231             elif str(_dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00232                 # sire known, dam unknown
00233                 if row == col:
00234                     pass
00235                 else:
00236                     a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,_sires[col]-1]
00237             if fill == 1:
00238                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00239             elif str(_sires[col]) != str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(_dams[col]) != str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00240                 # both parents known
00241                 if row == col:
00242                     a[row,col] = a[row,col] + ( 0.5 * a[_sires[col]-1,_dams[col]-1] )
00243                 else:
00244                     intermediate = a[row,_sires[col]-1] + a[row,_dams[col]-1]
00245                     a[row,col] = 0.5 * intermediate
00246                     if fill == 1:
00247                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00248             else:
00249                 print '[ERROR]: There is a problem with the sire (ID %s) and/or dam (ID %s) of animal %s' % (pedigree[col].sireID, pedigree[col].damID, pedigree[col].animalID)
00250                 break
00251     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00252         print '\t\t[pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()] Finished computing A at %s' %  pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time()
00253     #except:
00254     #    a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')  # initialize a matrix of zeros of appropriate order
00255 
00256     if save == 1:
00257         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedopts['filetag'],'_new_a_matrix_','.dat')
00258         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00259         label = 'Produced by pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix()\n'
00260         aout.write(label)
00261         for row in xrange(l):
00262             line = ''
00263             for col in xrange(l):
00264                 if col == 0:
00265                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00266                 else:
00267                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00268             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00269             aout.write(line)
00270         aout.close()
00271 
00272 #     try: logging.info('Exited fast_a_matrix()')
00273 #     except: pass
00274 #     print '\t\t\tExited pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix()'
00275     if debug:
00276         print a
00277     return a

00279 ##
00280 # Form a relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix_r() differs from fast_a_matrix() in that the
00281 # coefficients of relationship are corrected for the inbreeding of the parents.
00282 # @param pedigree A PyPedal pedigree.
00283 # @param pedopts PyPedal options.
00284 # @param save Flag to indicate whether or not the relationship matrix is written to a file.
00285 # @param method Use dense or sparse matrix storage.
00286 # @retval A relationship as Numarray matrix.
00287 def fast_a_matrix_r(pedigree, pedopts, save=0, method='dense'):
00288     """
00289     Form a relationship matrix from a pedigree.  fast_a_matrix_r() differs from
00290     fast_a_matrix() in that the coefficients of relationship are corrected for the
00291     inbreeding of the parents.
00292     """
00293     #try: logging.info('Entered fast_a_matrix_r()')
00294     #except: pass
00295     import math   # We need it for sqrt()
00296     animals = []
00297     sires = []
00298     dams = []
00299     #print pedigree
00300     l = len(pedigree)
00301     #method = 'dense'
00302     if method not in ['dense','sparse']:
00303         method = 'dense'
00304     try:
00305         # Use PySparse to provide sparse matrix storage for large
00306         # relationship matrices.
00307         if method == 'sparse':
00308             try:
00309                 a = spmatrix.ll_mat_sym(l*l)
00310                 for i in xrange(l):
00311                     a[i,i] = 1.
00312             except:
00313                 a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00314         # Otherwise, use NumPy and its dense matrices
00315         else:
00316             a = numpy.zeros([l,l],'d')
00317         for i in xrange(l):
00318             animals.append(int(pedigree[i].animalID))
00319             sires.append(int(pedigree[i].sireID))
00320             dams.append(int(pedigree[i].damID))
00321         # Poorly-written code -- loops twice.  Once to compute CoI and a second time to
00322         # correct CoR for parental inbreeding.
00323         for row in xrange(l):
00324             for col in xrange(row,l):
00325                 #print '[DEBUG]: row = %s\tcol = %s' % (row,col)
00326                 if str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00327                     if row == col:
00328                         # both parents unknown and assumed unrelated
00329                         a[row,col] = 1.
00330                 elif str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00331                     # sire unknown, dam known
00332                     if row == col:
00333                         a[row,col] = 1.
00334                     else:
00335                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,dams[col]-1]
00336                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00337                 elif str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00338                     # sire known, dam unknown
00339                     if row == col:
00340                         a[row,col] = 1.
00341                     else:
00342                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * a[row,sires[col]-1]
00343                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00344                 elif sires[col] != pedopts['missing_parent'] and dams[col] != pedopts['missing_parent']:
00345                     # both parents known
00346                     if row == col:
00347                         a[row,col] = 1. + ( 0.5 * a[sires[col]-1,dams[col]-1] )
00348                     else:
00349                         intermediate = a[row,sires[col]-1] + a[row,dams[col]-1]
00350                         a[row,col] = 0.5 * intermediate
00351                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00352                 else:
00353                     if pedopts['debug_messages'] and pedopts['messages'] != 'quiet':
00354                         print '[ERROR]: There is a problem with the sire (ID %s) and/or dam (ID %s) of animal %s' % (pedigree[col].sireID, pedigree[col].damID, pedigree[col].animalID)
00355                     break
00356         for row in xrange(l):
00357             for col in xrange(row,l):
00358                 if str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']) and str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00359                     pass
00360                 elif str(sires[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00361                     # sire unknown, dam known
00362                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00363                         numerator = 0.5 * a[row,dams[col]-1]
00364                         denominator = sqrt ( a[dams[col]-1,dams[col]-1] )
00365                         try:
00366                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00367                         except:
00368                             coefficient = 0.
00369                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00370                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00371                 elif str(dams[col]) == str(pedopts['missing_parent']):
00372                     # sire known, dam unknown
00373                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00374                         numerator = 0.5 * a[row,sires[col]-1]
00375                         denominator = sqrt ( a[sires[col]-1,sires[col]-1] )
00376                         try:
00377                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00378                         except:
00379                             coefficient = 0.
00380                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00381                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00382                 elif sires[col] != pedopts['missing_parent'] and dams[col] != pedopts['missing_parent']:
00383                     # both parents known
00384                     if row != col and a[row,col] > 0.:
00385                         numerator = 0.5 * ( a[row,sires[col]-1] + a[row,dams[col]-1] )
00386                         denominator = math.sqrt ( ( a[sires[col]-1,sires[col]-1] ) * ( a[dams[col]-1,dams[col]-1] ) )
00387                         try:
00388                             coefficient = numerator / denominator
00389                         except:
00390                             coefficient = 0.
00391                         a[row,col] = coefficient
00392                         a[col,row] = a[row,col]
00393                 else:
00394                     pass
00395     except:
00396         a = numpy.zeros([1,1],'d')
00397     # print a
00398     if save == 1:
00399         a_outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_a_matrix_r_','.dat')
00400         aout = open(a_outputfile,'w')
00401         label = 'Produced by pyp_nrm/fast_a_matrix_r()\n'
00402         aout.write(label)
00403         for row in xrange(l):
00404             line = ''
00405             for col in xrange(l):
00406                 if col == 0:
00407                     line = '%7.5f' % (a[row,col])
00408                 else:
00409                     line = '%s%s%s' % (line,',',a[row,col])
00410             line = '%s%s' % (line,'\n')
00411             aout.write(line)
00412         aout.close()
00413 
00414     #try: logging.info('Exited fast_a_matrix_r()')
00415     #except: pass
00416     return a
